title: Lodging Arrivals CheckIn at Front Desk
content: Lodging Arrivals CheckIn at Front Desk Lodging Arrivals (Check-In) at Front Desk Operating Procedure The goal of this procedure is to provide our Clients with a exceptional customer service and ensure that all the important details/information about their pet(s) is captured/verified. To prepare for the Clients and Guests that are scheduled to Arrive today, review the following in Gingr: Dashboards > Expected Today Front Desk staff should periodically review and monitor the "Expected Today" section throughout the day between Client interactions. This will better prepare you to help specific Clients when they arrive. When the Client and Pet(s) Arrive: GREET THE CLIENT STANDING UP Greet clients in a friendly manner: “Hello, how can I assist? Who do we have checking in today?” Search for the pet on the "Expected Today" section on the dashboard Verify the pet's vaccines and paperwork is up to date (a red shield icon will appear if records are needed, an orange shield will appear if a pet's records will expire soon, and no shield icon will appear if the pet is all up-to-date) . Keep in mind we have a 10-day grace period for records that have expired. Ask the client for any missing paperwork. If a client does not have a requirement or is past the 10-day grace period, DO NOT PROCEED and get a supervisor or manager for assistance. Press the 'check' button to check the pet in. Ask the clients if their pet has been fed today, and fill out the corresponding field on Gingr. Confirm pick up date and time Confirm services on reservation Confirm feeding information (Press the '+' button to add a new meal, and use the 'x' button to remove a meal. Simply deleting the text wont remove a meal - you need to press the 'x' button to completely delete the meal slot . If you need to change the feeding information that is already there, simply type over the existing text. Use caution and triple-check to make sure the feeding information is correct. Confirm medication information. ( To add medications, press the plus button to add each medication, add quantity, unit and medication instructions. ) To delete medications, you need to press the 'x' button next to the medication slot. Use caution and triple-check to make sure the medication information is correct. Also, there is a specific dates field in which you can add a medication to only specific date(s). Confirm phone number, email, and emergency contact If the client states anything about the pet that must be noted, write a note in the pet's file, note in their reservation, and tell the back staff about the information as soon as possible. Bringing pet to room: DOGS: Put ID collar on dog (IF DOG IS SHOWING AGGRESSION OR FEAR, ASK FOR A MANAGER!) Obtain room card (if guest is in a Luxury Suite, obtain a small piece of tape for the room card to attach it to the door. Proceed to bring dog back to room. Give pet a water bowl and fill with water after the pet is in their room. Don't worry about bedding - this is the back staff's duty. CATS: Obtain room card and small piece of tape to attach it to the door. Proceed to cat room. Put cat in room (Often times, cats can take longer than dogs to get in their rooms. If you are too busy, leave the cat in their own carrier in the cat room, and get back to it A.S.A.P. - also don't hesitate to ask for help if needed! Ensure cat has fresh water, litterbox is full and has a bed. Tape room card to door. After Client has left: After the client has left, Ensure the pet was successfully checked in on Gingr by refreshing the page. Staple an address label to the bag(s), stating: Pet's first and last name Room number Dates of reservation Example: Murphy White 2/8/24 - 2/12/24 E 8 Open up the reservation from the dashboard on Gingr. Simply click on the reservation type text (ex. "Standard Dog Boarding" to get to the reservation screen. Log the pet's belongings: Carefully count every bag of food they brought in. If the pet brought toys, blankets, etc, label each toy with masking tape with the pet's first and last name, room number, and dates of stay. List everything the pet brought in under the "describe pet's belongings" section. Write your initials next to the belongings. Example: " 4 bags food, green snake toy, gray t shirt, leash/collar - JW " Pet is successfully checked in! Note: If a pet changes anything with their reservation (play package, room number, etc), you must tell the back staff as soon as possible. If a pet adds on a grooming service for today's date, let the specific groomer know.

title: Gratuity Tips Overview
content: Gratuity Tips Overview Gratuity (Tips) Operating Procedure How to add a credit-card tip on an invoice at checkout: Once in cart, select the appropriate open line item type of either 'Tip (Bather)', 'Tip (Full Service Groomer)', or 'Tip (Staff)'. Add a description if appropriate. Enter the desired amount, and press the add to cart button. Once payment is processed, remove the tip amount from the cash drawer. If the groomer is here, hand the cash directly to the groomer. If the groomer is not here or available, securely bundle the cash together and write today's date, who the tip is to and from, and the amount of the tip on either a label or one of the small paper money pouches. Securely place the tip in the cash drawer. Note: all staff tips should be only be placed in the cash drawer after being labeled. Account for the tip by writing the information on the credit card tip log located at the front desk, on a clipboard. How to handle cash tips handed to you from a customer If the tip is for a bather or full-service groomer, hand the cash directly to the groomer if they are here. If the groomer is not here or available, securely bundle the cash together and write today's date, who the tip is to and from, and the amount of the tip on either a label or one of the small paper money pouches. Securely place the tip in the cash drawer. Note: all staff tips should be only be placed in the cash drawer after being labeled. How to charge a credit card tip to a service that has already been checked out Navigate directly to the cart. Select owner. Select the appropriate open line item type of either 'Tip (Bather)', 'Tip (Full Service Groomer)', or 'Tip (Staff)'. Add a description if appropriate. Enter the desired amount, and press the add to cart button. Process payment, then remove the tip amount from the cash drawer. If the groomer is here, hand the cash directly to the groomer. If the groomer is not here or available, securely bundle the cash together and write today's date, who the tip is to and from, and the amount of the tip on either a label or one of the small paper money pouches. Securely place the tip in the cash drawer. Note: all staff tips should be only be placed in the cash drawer after being labeled. Account for the tip by writing the information on the credit card tip log located at the front desk, on a clipboard.

title: Booking Reservations Boarding and Daycare
content: Booking Reservations Boarding and Daycare Booking Reservations (Boarding and Daycare) Operating Procedure This procedure will ensure that all boarding and daycare reservations are booked accurately, efficiently, and easily! Important Notes: We only require deposits for boarding reservations, not daycare. One deposit per family is required, not per pet. If a pet stays for more than 2 weeks, we charge their card on file every week and apply a pre-payment to their reservation. We must let the client know of this, and we must keep a card on file for these situations. Dogs are mandated to have a play package, but cats are not. Please use the icons to see what the client typically gets when booking a reservation. If booking a daycare reservation, ensure the correct daycare type is being booked - there are lots of different options, so be sure to check client's history and ask the client if you are unsure. DOG BOARDING: Start by navigating to the 'New Reservation' screen. There are two ways to achieve this: On the left hand side menu on Gingr, go to Reservations > New Reservation. Or, on pet or owner profile screen, press the calendar with plus button at the top right of the screen, and press 'New Reservation.' Ensure pet(s)' name is selected under the 'Pet's' section. Ensure last name is correct and the correct pet(s) are selected. If a pet has Icons for their desired room, play package, and play type assigned, they will automatically display once you go to create a reservation. Please use this data in the proceeding steps. Select correct booking type under the 'Type' section . Select start date and time, and end date and time. Under additional services, assign the correct play package: Open the ‘Additional Services’ section. Select desired play package. Press ‘Every Day’ Press ‘Add to Reservation’ (if you do not do these steps in order, it will not save.) Note: if a client is existing, use the displayed icons to view what the client typically gets, use this information to assign play package and boarding type. If desired, assign any grooming appointment. See below if you need help with this. Select ' Lodging - [ Pet's Name ] (xx Lbs ) ' to open up the lodging areas - we want to assign a room for the dog. Select the desired lodging area to open view all available rooms. Press ‘+’ button to assign the pet to the desired room. (Yellow means a pet is already occupying that room, you must select an open room for all dates of stay). If necessary, write any reservation notes under the 'Notes' section. If customer asks for an estimate, you can use the estimate section to see what each individual price is. DO NOT give totals for boarding stays, since there are many factors that can change the total price of the reservation before the pet leaves. However, you may give them each individual price. Once all details are entered, press ' Save ' at the bottom of the screen. Take the $50 deposit (one per family) see "Checking Out Pets" procedure if you need help with processing payments. If you need to access the reservation for any reason after you press save, you can do so by clicking on the confirmation link at the bottom of the screen as soon as you press save, or you can do so by searching for the client's name in Gingr and go to the reservations section to locate the reservation. CAT BOARDING: Start by navigating to the 'New Reservation' screen. There are two ways to achieve this: On the left hand side menu on Gingr, go to Reservations > New Reservation. Or, on pet or owner profile screen, press the calendar with plus button at the top right of the screen, and press 'New Reservation.' Ensure pet(s)' name is selected under the 'Pet's' section. Ensure last name is correct and the correct pet(s) are selected. If a pet has Icons for their desired room, play package, and play type assigned, they will automatically display once you go to create a reservation. Please use this data in the proceeding steps. Ensure ' Cat Boarding ' option is selected under the 'Type' section. Select start date and time, and end date and time. Under additional services, assign the correct play package, if desired: Open the ‘Additional Services’ section. Select desired play package. Press ‘Every Day’ Press ‘Add to Reservation’ (if you do not do these steps in order, it will not save.) Note: if a client is existing, use the displayed icons to view what the client typically gets, use this information to assign play package. Next, assign the cat a room: Select ' Lodging - [ Pet's Name ] (xx Lbs ) ' to open up the lodging areas - we want to assign a room for the cat. Select the 'Cat Room' lodging area to view all available rooms. Press ‘+’ button to assign the pet to the desired room (Yellow means a pet is already occupying that room, you must select an open room for all dates of stay). If necessary, write any reservation notes under the 'Notes' section. If customer asks for an estimate, you can use the estimate section to see what each individual price is. DO NOT give totals for boarding stays, since there are many factors that can change the total price of the reservation before the pet leaves. However, you may give them each individual price. Once all details are entered, press ' Save ' at the bottom of the screen. Take the $50 deposit (one per family) see "Checking Out Pets" procedure if you need help with processing payments. If you need to access the reservation for any reason after you press save, you can do so by clicking on the confirmation link at the bottom of the screen as soon as you press save, or you can do so by searching for the client's name in Gingr and go to the reservations section to locate the reservation. DOGGIE DAYCARE: Start by navigating to the 'New Reservation' screen. There are two ways to achieve this: On the left hand side menu on Gingr, go to Reservations > New Reservation. Or, on pet or owner profile screen, press the calendar with plus button at the top right of the screen, and press 'New Reservation.' Ensure pet(s)' name is selected under the 'Pet's' section. Ensure last name is correct and the correct pet(s) are selected. If a pet has Icons for their desired room, play package, and play type assigned, they will automatically display once you go to create a reservation. Please use this data in the proceeding steps. Select correct booking type under the 'Type' section . Select date. If desired, assign any grooming appointment. See below if you need help with this. If client is a first time daycare, assign the ' First Day! ' service under the ' Additional Services ' section. If necessary, write any reservation notes under the 'Notes' section. If customer asks for an estimate, you can use the estimate section to quickly see what the daycare price is. Once all details are entered, press ' Save ' at the bottom of the screen. It will display a notice saying, "A lodging must be selected for each date of this reservation." Proceed to press 'Override & Create,' as we do not reserve rooms for daycare reservations in advance. If you need to access the daycare reservation for any reason after you press save, you can do so by clicking on the confirmation link at the bottom of the screen as soon as you press save, or you can do so by searching for the client's name in Gingr and go to the reservations section to locate the reservation. How to add a grooming service on to boarding or daycare reservations: In the editing reservation screen, Open the 'Additional Services' Section, then Open desired grooming service. You may write notes under the 'Service Notes' section if necessary. Select specialist (if bath, the default is always “Paws Bather”. If service is full groom with haircut, please assign to the correct specialist. Select the desired date. Select time. If the button is red, it means we are full for that time, if it is green it means we have availability for that time. How to check to see if services were added on successfully:

title: OPG Fecal Processing Guide
content: OPG Fecal Processing Guide OPG Fecal Processing Guide Operating Procedure Reasons pet parents will want you to process fecal samples: ● Convenience... they don't need to be hassled with collecting a sample, taking it to their vet and getting the results back to you ● Low Cost... similar price as the vet without any of the work ● Expertise... samples processed by the same national lab veterinarians use ● Fast... results come back the next day! Fecal samples must be paid for prior to us processing them. The OPG fecal test is a retail option on Gingr. How to Process a Fecal Sample: Step 1 Have the sample collected and put into the collection tube and write the pet name on the tube. Make sure there is at least a sample the size of a large marble. Step 2 Log into the Canine Lab Testing website at www.caninelabtesting.com and click on “Login” at the top right. Use your login credentials to get into the site. Username is info@pawspet.com. Step 3 1. Click on New Test Request 2. Enter the client information 3. Enter the pet information 4. Select Next Step at the bottom right 5. Select which test you want to perform, click on Next Step 6. Enter your business credit card number (not the Pet Parent’s credit card!) 7. Click on Complete Payment 8. A popup of the lab request will appear, click on print above the pop up 9. After printing click on ✓finish 10. Another pop-up will appear giving you directions to call the courier at 800-719-2226. The automated system will ask for the account number 180443 and the zip code of your facility. 11.The automated system will also give you a confirmation number Step 4 Place the fecal tube with the sample in the bag AND place the printed test request in the bag. Step 5 Place the prepared sample into the white lab box. How to Retrieve Test Results Log into the Canine Lab Testing website at www.caninelabtesting.com and click on “Login” at the top right. Newest results are at the top. If a result’s Status is Final you can select the action button on the right and you will have the option of viewing or emailing the result. Fecal samples can be submitted 7 days a week, the courier will pick up Mon-Sat. If you have any questions or issues you must contact the owners of Canine Lab Testing, Greg at (203) 650-4461 or John at (203) 605-0753. Antech will not be able to help you.

title: Room Assignments and Size Requirements
content: Room Assignments and Size Requirements Room Assignments and Size Requirements Operating Procedure This procedure is designed to ensure that all arriving guests have been assigned an appropriate room to reside in during their entire stay at Paws Pet Resort & Spa. Boarding/Lodging: Standard Dog Boarding: Mini Mansions: Book these rooms for dogs under 25Lbs by default, unless requested otherwise. East: Short/Weekend stays, use this hallway first! North: use next (ONLY IF IT IS OPEN). Use North for ONLY long stays (5 days +). West: if North is not open, use this hallway. If North is open, use after North and East are booked. In-Between: Use after the preceding areas are full. Outside West: Use after the preceding areas are full. Luxury Dog Boarding: 1st Luxury Hallway (a.k.a. New Luxuries): Use first. 2nd Luxury Hallway (a.k.a. Old Luxuries): Use after 1st hallway is full. If there are any very large breeds or families with multiple pets, reserve a King Suite (LK) for them if available. Cat Boarding: Use CR 1 - CR 9 first. ​​​​​​​Note: If there are multiple cats in the same family, we can fit a maximum of two cats per room. Note: CR 2 and CR 4 can be connected into one large area, if a family with multiple pets want the extra large space. Use both portable units after CR 1 - CR 9 are used. Note: If any cats cannot fit through the porthole in CR 1 - CR 9, assign them to a Portable Unit. Daycare: Save "Jumbo" rooms for very large dogs or families with multiple pets. Room assignment order: Small Dogs: Start with Mini Mansions, unless otherwise desired. Medium/Large Dogs: West -> East -> In-Between -> Outside West -> Luxuries -> North. ​​​​​​​ Please follow this graphic to ensure all dogs are assigned to the correct size of rooms: Also, here is our to-scale suite map in case you need to see where all the rooms are!

title: Taking a Message
content: Taking a Message Taking a Message Operating Procedure This procedure will outline how to leave a great message for someone, and make sure important messages are responded to in a timely manner. Taking a Message If someone calls and is asking for someone who is unavailable, you must take a message for them. Write on the phone message book sheet: Who the call is for Today's date and time Name of person calling and if applicable, what company they are calling from The caller's phone number Why they are calling Be sure to sign your name at the bottom of the sheet. PLEASE GIVE THE MESSAGE TO THE PERSON AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. If the person is unavailable, please text them a picture of the message book sheet.

title: Printing a Room Card
content: Printing a Room Card Printing a Room Card Operating Procedure Important note: all room cards and ID collars should be printed in the morning, using the 'Reception Tasks Before Opening' procedure. This particular procedure is only for the following cases: Room card is damaged and needs a replacement. Pet is staying longer than the dates on the original room card. A pet shows up without a reservation. Printing a Room Card Access the 'Run Card' document on the 'Paws HQ' Google Sheets document. Print out one copy (or however many copies you need). Once the correct number of run card bottoms are printed, put them in the printer tray faced down, with the printed material at the top. Navigate to the desired pet's reservation. At the top right of the screen, press the print button, and press 'Print Run Card'. Proceed to print it out. The room card has been successfully printed (should have the pet's info on top, and the elimination/feeding chart at the bottom.) On the top left of each room card for dogs only, write what type of play they go to (individual, big, small, or medium). If the dog needs to be evaluated for group, write 'eval'. For all areas besides Luxury Suites and Cat Rooms, fold paper in half and put it in a plastic sleeve. For Luxury Suites and Cat Rooms, use a small piece of tape and stick the room card sheet to their door. :) Note: if pet has not arrived yet, place the room card on the table next to the R2 desk - where all the other room cards are.

title: Filing and Pulling Daycare Room Cards
content: Filing and Pulling Daycare Room Cards Filing and Pulling Daycare Room Cards Operating Procedure We pride ourselves on efficient and easy daycare arrivals in the morning. This procedure will outline how to do a fantastic job filing and pulling daycare room cards. Filing Daycare Cards When a daycare leaves, place the card near the daycare card bin or file it immediately. Filing daycare cards means putting them in the bin in perfect alphabetical order by LAST NAME . If you notice any duplicates, boarding cards, or dogs who have not been here in month's room cards, please remove them and discard them. We need to constantly maintain our beloved room card bin. Pulling Daycare Room Cards for Tomorrow You must obtain a daycare list for tomorrow to identify what cards to pull. Navigate to 'Reports & More' > 'Reports' > 'Reservations By Day'. Select the tomorrow's date. In the 'Reservation Types' section, select only the daycare options. Press 'Generate Report'. "X" out of either the 'Check Ins' or 'Check Outs' section. Since daycares are for only one day, we must "X" out of one of them, otherwise the report will be duplicated. Then, press 'Print PDF' to print. You must pull all of the cards on this list. If any cards are not in the bin already, you must print a new one. Navigate to the pet's daycare reservation. At the top right of the screen, press the print button and press 'Print Run Card'. Note: Unlike boarding cards, daycare room cards DO NOT need a run card bottom. Mark up the run card - cross off room number if it has it, cross off reservation type and date, and write 'D/C' to show it is a daycare card. Then put the card in a plastic sleeve and file away. Pulling daycare room cards: putting the card "up" 90 degrees so it stands taller, making it easier to locate. ALL room cards need to be filed and pulled the night advance. Run card bin maintenance Whenever possible, it is important to remove any duplicates, boarding cards, or dogs who have not been here for month's room cards. We should remove any we find and discard them. Whenever possible, look through the entire bin, A-Z, to find any cards that should not be there.

title: Phone Calls
content: Phone Calls Phone Calls Overview The vast majority of our sales come from phone calls - it's pretty important! This overview will outline some more information on how to ensure phone calls are conducted properly. Adding a '1' when dialing outside numbers Whenever you are dialing a phone number that does not start with '203' or '860', you must input the number 1 before dialing the number. If this is not done, the call will never go through. Smile when on the phone! Customers can pick up on your energy over the phone. Even though the customer cannot see you, smiling when speaking with customers over the phone can really increase the energy on the call. When you don't know the response to a question If a customer asks you something, and you don't know the answer, please ask one of your coworkers or a manager. Never assume anything - we want to make sure we are giving customers truthful responses.

title: Fecal Test Result Chart
content: Fecal Test Result Chart Parasite Test Result Chart Guide to canine parasite found in OPG testing Parasite Reported Contagious to Humans Contagious to other dogs Need to treat? Comments Giardia cysts yes yes Refer to veterinarian1 Giardia Elisa Positive n/a n/a Refer to veterinarian1 Roundworms yes yes Refer to veterinarian1 See note2 Hookworm eggs yes yes Refer to veterinarian1 See note2 Whipworm eggs no no Refer to veterinarian1 See note2 Cystoisospora oocysts no yes Refer to veterinarian1 Anoplocephala eggs no no no See note3 Eimeria Oocysts no no no See note3 Strongyle eggs no no no See note3 Ascarid eggs no no no See note3 Invertebrate Coccidian oocysts no no no See note3 Rhabditiform larvae no no no Indicates that fecal sample may be old(ie sitting in the yard for a few days) Consider retesting. Anoplocephala eggs no no no See note3 Alaria eggs rare no Refer to veterinarian1 This is a very rare finding and would warrant retesting Capillaria (Eucoleus) Aerophila eggs rare no Refer to veterinarian1 This is a very rare finding and would warrant retesting Tapeworms4 no no Refer to veterinarian1 note4 note1 In many cases dogs will need to be treated for the parasites listed as “refer to veterinarian”. But there are instances where a veterinarian may not treat or need to retest based on the pet’s history, signalment, and lifestyle. note2 This parasite is usually prevented when a pet is on an appropriate monthly heartworm prevention. Some companies provide a guarantee with their product. note3 This parasite is not infectious or contagious, but it does indicate the pet is hunting small wild animals (such as mice/chipmunks/rabbits) or is eating wild animal feces. note4 Tapeworms are not normally reported on fecal test results. Fortunately they are not contagious, but they are infectious and need to be treated. Tapeworm segments are normally diagnosed by a veterinarian by observation with the naked eye. Either on a fecal sample or the perianal region. A veterinarian can then place the segment onto a slide and set a microscope to low-power and determine if the tapeworm segment came from the pet eating a flea or eating a rodent. The OP fecal is a microscope test that is looking for microscopic eggs/cysts/organisms on high-power so they cannot observe tapeworm segments References Capcvet.org Cdc.gov Nih.gov Version 20230818

title: DropOff and PickUp Times
content: DropOff and PickUp Times Drop-Off and Pick-Up Times Overview Facility Hours: Monday-Friday Saturday Sunday 7AM-7PM 9AM-5PM 9-11AM and 3-5PM BOARDING: In general, we recommend the earlier, the better, since it allows us to start playtime earlier, in addition to other factors. Monday-Friday: 9AM to 5PM Clients can drop off as soon as 7AM, but to avoid the daycare rush, we recommend the hours above. Can drop off past 5PM if there is management approval. Saturday: 9AM to 5PM Sunday: 9AM-11AM, 3PM-5PM. DAYCARE: Monday-Friday: Drop-off and pickup can be anytime from 7AM to 7PM. Recommended hours are: 7AM-9AM Drop-off, 3PM-7PM Pick-up to ensure pet receives all playtimes. Saturday: 9AM to 5PM Sunday: 9AM-11AM, 3PM-5PM. (Note: we cannot do half-days on Sundays, as we are closed in the middle of the day.)

title: Bad Words Better Replacements
content: Bad Words Better Replacements Bad Words & Better Replacements Overview It is imperative to paint a positive picture of our exceptional care by choosing the right words. This overview will outline words that should never be used, and better replacements for them. " Bad" Word > Instead, use: Better Replacement No (Your'e Wrong) > Instead, use: Actually No (Can't/Won't) > Instead, use: Wish we could Problem/Trouble > Instead, use: Questions Kennel > Instead, use: Sleeping Area/Lodging Area Cage > Instead, use: Suite/Enclosure Boarding > Instead, use: Lodging/Overnight Accomodations Picky Eater > Instead, use: Selective, nibbler Kennel Cough > Instead, use: Canine Cough Isolation > Instead, use: Private Area Price Increase > Instead, use: Price Adjustments Calm Down > Instead, use: I'm sure I can help Fixed > Instead, use: Neutered/Spayed Stress > Instead, use: Sensitive Thanks > Instead, use: Thank you Out of Control Dog > Instead, use: Challenging Shots > Instead, use: Vaccinations Can't > Instead, use: What we can do Well > Instead, use: Don't say it! Huh? > Instead, use: Excuse me Ward > Instead, use: Wing Fat > Instead, use: Spoiled/Pampered Hyper > Instead, use: Energetic Cancelation > Instead, use: Opening Fine > Instead, use: Great, I'm Terrific, Excellent! Ok, Yeah, Yes > Instead, use: Absolutely, Certainly, My Pleasure, Of Course, I'd Be Happy To

title: Providing Excellent Customer Service
content: Providing Excellent Customer Service Providing Excellent Customer Service Operating Procedure Our customers are why we are here. Every customer should be listened to and valued in order to feel good about leaving their pets here with us. We are honored that they entrust us with their most beloved pets, and it is our duty to provide nothing but the best customer service. First Impression Matters Please ensure the lobby is in excellent condition. Making sure it smells good, free of hair/debris on the floor, and is organized are key to a great first impression. In order to portray a professional appearance, we value having the front desk staff wearing collared shirts and a genuine smile. The front desk staff should be as neat as possible and on the conservative side, i.e. no excessive piercings, gum chewing, etc. Our objective is to present ourselves as being organized, caring, courteous, professional, and trustworthy - our customers deserve our best! Greeting Customers As soon as a customer walks in, you must halt what you are doing, and greet the customer. Even if you are handling another task, you must still acknowledge the customer and let them know you will be with them shortly. All staff will greet every customer they encounter with a big smile and a friendly, genuine, enthusiastic greeting. If their dog is present, greet the dog as well. Greet the dog by name if possible and say something nice about the dog. If there is a client in the lobby and you are unsure if they are being taken care of, always ask if they are being assisted. Check in and out pets as fast as possible, while maintaining accuracy. We don't want our customers to wait in the lobby for a long time. Use caution with what you say if there are customers in the lobby. Even if you think they can't hear you, they may be able to. Importance of a 'Paws'-itive attitude No matter how busy it is, it is important to portray to our customers that we have things under control. We do not want them to "see us sweat." Everyone at Paws must come to work with a 'paws'-itive attitude each and every day. A negative attitude can spread among coworkers and very quickly lead to a negative work environment. The pets deserve our best performance, and a "can-do" attitude is necessary to provide excellent care no matter the circumstance. Regardless of personal feelings or challenges, we commit to setting aside any distractions at the door and dedicating ourselves wholeheartedly to delivering the best possible experience for both the animals and customers in our care every single day. Unconditional Listening We must always listen to our customers, even if we think they are wrong. Remember, "the customer is always right!" If a customer takes the time to tell us something, it is clearly something they are concerned about so much that they thought they would let us know. They are providing us with valuable feedback, and it is imperative to unconditionally listen and try to help as best you can! NEVER argue with a customer. Instead, listen attentively and genuinely try to understand what they are saying. If you deem what they are saying is incorrect, instead of using the words "you're wrong," say "actually,..." and proceed to describe the truth. If you are uncomfortable speaking with a customer, ask for a supervisor or manager.

title: Front Desk Receives Inquiry and the Reservation Specialist in Unavailable
content: Front Desk Receives Inquiry and the Reservation Specialist in Unavailable Front Desk Receives Inquiry and the Reservation Specialist in Unavailable Operating Procedure Phone Script: Customer: “Can I get a price?" "Do you have availability?" Front Desk: "Our welcoming staff is currently helping another customer and will be happy to get back to you as soon as possible. They will be able to provide you with all the information you need including pricing and availability. What is the best number to reach you? What is the best time to reach you?" Immediately write a note for a follow-up call for a reservation specialist: Write down: Client's phone number Best time to reach the client Client's first Name Your initials Today's date and time Securely place the note on the reservation specialist's desk. ALL PHONE CALLS MUST BE RETURNED BY THE END OF DAY. Management approval is necessary if this cannot be done.

title: Reception Tasks Before Opening
content: Reception Tasks Before Opening Reception Tasks Before Opening Operating Procedure This is an overview of the important tasks reception must do before opening our doors. Printing Boarding Arrival Room Cards Navigate to 'Reports & More' > 'Reports' > 'Print Run Cards' Select today's date. Under 'Reservation Type', select only the boarding options. Press 'Print Run Cards!' - DO NOT ACTUALLY PRINT THEM YET! At the top right of the screen, it will say 'Run Card 1 of [XX] ' Look at the total number of run cards. In a new tab (not closing out of the old tab) , access the 'Run Card' document on the 'Paws HQ' Google Sheets document. Print out the correct total number of run card bottoms. Once the correct number of run card bottoms are printed, put them in the printer tray faced down, with the printed material at the top. Navigate back to the old tab with all the arrival room cards, and press print. The room cards have been successfully printed. On the top left of each room card for dogs only, write what type of play they go to (individual, big, small, or medium). If the dog needs to be evaluated for group, write 'eval'. For all areas besides Luxury Suites and Cat Rooms, fold paper in half and put it in a plastic sleeve. Place all room cards on the table next to the R2 desk in alphabetical order and separated by area for easy access. Also, make sure there is tape to hang up the Luxury Suite and Mini Mansion room cards. Printing ID collars for all arriving boarding dogs Note: only dogs get ID collars. On the 'Expected Today' section on the dashboard, search 'dog boarding'. Filter by lodging type to sort pets by area. Open every filtered reservation in a new tab - to do this, click on the text for the type of the reservation (ex: 'Standard Dog Boarding'). Either right click the text and press open in a new tab, or simply push the scroll wheel down to open the reservation in a new tab. Proceed to open all reservations in their own new tab. Navigate to the first tab you opened, and press the print button at the top right, and then click 'Print Labels'. This will give you access to a printing preview screen. (Note: if this does not show up, it is because pop-ups are disabled. You must enable popups in order for this screen to show up.) Press CTRL + P to print - ensure the destination is set to 'Petdetect Raster Printer' Under 'Copies' you must use the chart below to determine how long the collar will be. Smaller Breeds (<35 Lbs) Medium or Larger Breeds (~35-80 Lbs) (Most Common) Extra Large Breeds (>80 Lbs) 3 Labels Long 4 Labels Long 5 Labels Long Once the correct number of copies is entered and the correct printing destination is set, print out the label. Labels should be printing now - if they are not, We have a switch (on the cash drawer) to swap between printing from the R1/R2 computer. Ensure that the light on the switch refects the computer you are currently using. Ensure there is a roll of label tape fed into the label printer (the colored side should be down - the roll of label tape fed into the machine should be the one on the left. There must be three rolls of label tape, side-by-side, in order for the label printer to work properly. Again - only the leftmost roll should be fed into the machine. If the label machine is stalling/not printing well, ensure the roll is aligned perfectly, with no additional slack. If the label machine is not cutting each collar well, wipe off the blade CAREFULLY with a disinfectant wipe. Remove all built-on gunk with the wipe and it should cut perfectly after. Proceed to print all ID collars. Once all ID collars are printed, stick them to the back wall behind the reception desk in room order (remove one smaller section of the back of the sticker and place on wall). Double-check that all ID collars have been correctly printed.

title: Checking Responding to Emails and Updating Immunization Records
content: Checking Responding to Emails and Updating Immunization Records Checking & Responding to Emails and Updating Immunization Records Operating Procedure This procedure will ensure all emails are viewed, all files are updated, and all clients are responded to, in addition to updating pet's immunization records. All emails are responded to throughout the day, and all emails must be completed before the day ends. Please check the spam folder as well. Logging into our company email: Go to www.mail.yahoo.com Login: Use the email: pawspet@pawspet.com (Note: our actual email address is info@pawspet.com, but when signing in, you must use pawspet@pawspet.com.) Use the autofilled password to sign in. (ask a manager for the password if it is not autofilling) If there are any emails in the inbox, they must be responded to. Most emails are vaccination records being sent over. How to handle vaccination record emails: Open the email sent from the client or veterinarian. Open the attachment(s) sent in the email. Navigate to the specific owner's file in Gingr. Either click on the red or yellow shield icon next to the pet's name, or open up the 'Immunizations' section on the animal's profile to open the immunization management screen. On the immunization management screen, enter the new expiration dates that the client had sent over. Don't forget to press save when you are done! After the new expiration dates have been updated, upload the documents to the owner's file on Gingr: On the owner's file in Gingr, click on the 'Upload File' button. Drag and drop files into this spot, a.k.a. the dropbox. If this is not working, download the file from the email, then click on ‘Drop files here to upload’ to upload the files directly from the computer instead. Check for green confirmation at top right of the screen to ensure files were successfully uploaded. Good job! After files were updated and documents were uploaded, respond to the email: If the client is up to date with everything, respond to the email saying they are all up-to-date in our system. Example: Thank you for sending this information over! [Pet's Name] is now all up to date in our system! Have a Pawsome day! If the client is missing record(s), respond to the email with what we are missing. Example: Thank you for sending this information over! It looks like we still need [Pet's Name]'s [Missing Vaccine Name]. Have a Pawsome day!

title: Day Care Arrivals CheckIn at Front Desk
content: Day Care Arrivals CheckIn at Front Desk Day Care Arrivals (Check-In) at Front Desk Policy & Operating Procedure The goal of this procedure is to provide our Clients with exceptional customer service and ensure that all the important details/information about their pet(s) is captured/verified. To prepare for the Clients and Guests that are scheduled to arrive today, review the following in Gingr: Dashboard -> Expected Today Search the word "Daycare" to filter only by daycare to see all the daycare guests scheduled to arrive today. It will also display the total amount on the right-hand side of the search bar. Search the phrase 'First Day' to identify any first time daycares. Please use extra care with first time clients and pets. When the Client and Pet(s) Arrive: GREET THE CLIENT STANDING UP Greet clients in a friendly manner: “Hello, how can I assist? Who do we have checking in today?” On the 'Expected Today' section, search by the dog's first or last name ( you cannot search by both at the same time! ). Ensure you confident about the pet's first AND last name ( we have lots of Bellas! ) Verify the pet's vaccines and paperwork is up to date (a red shield icon will appear if records are needed, an orange shield will appear if a pet's records will expire soon, and no shield icon will appear if the pet is all up-to-date) . Keep in mind we have a 10-day grace period for records that have expired. Ask the client for any missing paperwork. If a client does not have a requirement or is past the 10-day grace period, DO NOT PROCEED and get a supervisor or manager for assistance. Press the menu button next to the pet's name ( three lines, looks like a hamburger ), and then press 'Edit Booking Details' Then, Select ' Lodging - [ Pet's Name ] (xx Lbs ) ' to open up the lodging areas - we want to assign a room for the dog. Select the desired lodging area to open view all available rooms. Press ‘+’ button to assign the pet to the desired room. Note: If you are unsure of where to book a dog, please see the information at the bottom of this document. Scroll down and press save! Obtain pet and pet's room card, and with the pet, proceed to the chosen room. If you see the room is unexpectedly currently being occupied or being cleaned, proceed to the closest computer to change the pet's room number and proceed to the new room. Place room card outside of room and put dog in room. Ensure everything is removed from the dog (harnesses, leashes, collars). Place any food, treats, or toys the pet may have brought in the basket outside their room. Note: If dog is in Mini Mansions or Double Deckers, leave the leash, harness, and/or collar in the basket outside of their room as well. Proceed to hallway with pet's leash, harness and/or collar. Note: if pet also brings a bag that is too big to put in the basket, take the important belongings out of the bag and put them in the basket and proceed to the next step with the pet's bag. Place their leash, harness, and/or collar (and bag, if applicable) on the appropriate, labeled hook in the hallway. PLEASE MAKE SURE IT IS ON THE RIGHT HOOK! Ensure Gingr reflects the pet's accurate room. Note: If a pet changes anything with their reservation (daycare type, different service, etc), you must tell the back staff as soon as possible. If a pet adds on a grooming service for today's date, let the specific groomer know. WHERE TO ASSIGN DAYCARE DOGS: - Save "Jumbo" rooms for very large dogs or families with multiple pets. Room assignment order: Small Dogs: Start with Mini Mansions, unless otherwise desired. Medium/Large Dogs: West -> East -> In-Between -> Outside West -> Luxuries -> North.

title: Adding a Service Addon to an Existing Grooming Service
content: Adding a Service Addon to an Existing Grooming Service Adding a Service Add-on to an Existing Grooming Service Operating Procedure Adding a service add-on to an existing grooming service: Navigate to the desired reservation or appointment. Open the 'Services' tab. Select the menu button (three lines, looks like a hamburger), next to the grooming service. Select 'Edit Service'. Select the desired service add-on(s) Press 'Save Changes!' at the bottom of the screen to save.

title: Review Audit Invoices
content: Review Audit Invoices Review & Audit Invoices Operating Procedure This procedure will help to ensure all invoices for the day are correct. Please see the "Checking Out Pets" procedure for a more in-depth view of checking out pets. Late Checkout Policy: Late checkout price: Cost of one nightly lodging rate, will be charged: Normal: If has Bath or Groom: After 11:00AM After 3:00PM * 5:00PM on Sundays To ensure all information is correct, follow this additional information: Daycare, Grooming, and Retail Invoices: Once again, at check out you must review each item, line by line, to ensure the receipt is accurate. If there is a grooming service on reservation, insure it has a price. If you are sure it was not completed, keep the service on the reservation without a price, as we want to keep a record of it. Ensure pet care warranty quantity is correct

title: Checking Out Pets
content: Checking Out Pets Checking Out Pets Operating Procedure To check out any reservation or appointment: Greet customer with warm smile, ask who they are picking up (pet's first AND LAST NAME! ) . Start by looking at what room the pet is in from the dashboard. From the dashboard, click the cart button to add the reservation or appointment to the cart. If a dog has daycare punches, there will be a "quick checkout" button, which will automatically check the dog out. This button will work only if the daycare reservation has no add-ons attached. If the daycare reservation has services attached, proceed to the next step. Navigate to the check-out page by clicking the cart icon on the top right of the screen. Based on the reservation or appointment type, follow the steps below this checklist to ensure accurate check-outs. Come back here once you have followed the steps. Once you have followed the steps below this checklist and confirmed the invoice has the correct pricing, Press the 'Check Out With Payment' Button. Select payment method If using credit card, Gingr may show a credit card may already be on file. Ask client if it is ok to use it. If a credit card is not on file already, select the 'Credit Card' payment method. If the client has the card in person, select 'WisePos E' to connect to the credit card terminal to swipe or tap it. If the credit card terminal is not working, enter it manually into Gingr: You may also manually enter the credit card information into Gingr. Select 'Enter Card Number in Gingr' to do this. Always ask client if they would like to save the new card to their file for future use. In this case, select the 'Save Card to File?' option BEFORE processing the credit card. If using cash, Select 'Cash' payment method. Collect appropriate amount of cash from customer, and put it in the cash drawer (there is a set of keys for the cash drawer in each reception desk.) Give back any change. If using check, Select 'Check' payment method. Collect check, ensure it has the accurate price. Stamp the back of the check with one of the "Pay to the Order of..." stamp machines that is in the reception desk drawers. Place check in cash drawer. If the payment method is split or if there is a store credit or gift certificate: If there are multiple payment methods, enter the desired amount of the first payment method. For any additional payment methods, select 'Add Payment Method.' If there is a store credit, mention this at checkout to the client and use this payment method first. If the customer brings in a coupon, use the 'Gift Certificate' or 'Customer Appreciation' payment method first, enter the amount of the gift certificate or coupon, and proceed to collect the remaining balance with the client's desired form of payment. Be sure to collect and discard of any coupons or gift certificates from clients, as they can only be used once. Charge the balance and ensure there is no remaining balance left. Once payment has been processed, ask client if they would like an emailed or printed receipt. Gingr will automatically bring up this screen after payment is processed. If you forgot what room the pet is in, navigate to the 'Lodging Calendar' and do a ' CTRL + F ' search for the pet's name. Be sure to keep in mind last name as well! (We have lots of Bellas!) Obtain the pet's belongings and give them to the client first. Use the leash if they brought one in, and: Proceed to get pet(s) from their room If a pet is not in their room, they may be in playtime or grooming. Check these two areas and if still not located, ask coworkers as they will likely know where the pet is. Ensure the right pet is returned to owner by checking ID collar if applicable and asking coworkers if you are unsure. Bring them to their owner! "Have a wonderful rest of your day!" Lodging Departures Once the reservation is added to the cart, TO ADJUST SOMETHING OFF AN INVOICE: Add an open line item to the cart. Select type as 'Price Adjustment,' enter a description of what the adjustment is, and enter the price in. Adjusting peak rates: If the departure day is a peak date and late checkout is not charged, you must remove one peak rate charge from the invoice. This is because Gingr charges the peak rate daily, but the lodging rate nightly. The price of a peak charge is $10 per day. Please add an open line item of 'Price Adjustment', type 'Peak' under description, and enter in -10. If there are multiple pets in the family, you must add a -10 peak line item for each pet in the family. REMINDER: THIS IS ONLY WHEN THE LAST DAY IS A PEAK DATE, AND THE LATE CHECKOUT FEE IS NOT CHARGED. Late checkout: Cost of one nightly lodging rate, will be charged: Normal: If has Bath or Groom: After 11:00AM After 3:00PM * 5:00PM on Sundays HOW TO WAIVE LATE CHECKOUT (if applicable): Once item is in cart, start by seeing what the nightly lodging rate is. Click the arrow next to where it says "Reservation For [ Pet's Name ]" to locate this. If the departure day is a peak date, add both the nightly lodging rate listed and the peak charge, which is an additional $10 together to get a total late checkout fee. (Example: if the rate says $59.95, and it is a peak date, add $10 to get $69.95). Add an open line item: Use the 'Waive Late Checkout | Grooming Service' and enter in the lodging price you discovered in step 2. (Make sure it is a negative price) Add the discount to the cart, and proceed to the next steps of the checkout process. You must review each item, line by line, to ensure the receipt is accurate. To ensure all information is correct, follow this information: Daycare, Grooming, and Retail Invoices: Once again, at check out you must review each item, line by line, to ensure the receipt is accurate. If there is a grooming service on reservation, insure it has a price. If you are sure it was not completed, keep the service on the reservation without a price, as we want to keep a record of it. Ensure pet care warranty quantity is correct HOW TO CHECK OUT A CUSTOMER FOR A PUNCHCARD (DAYCARE PACKAGE) OR A RETAIL ITEM: Navigate directly to the cart (press the cart button on the top right of the screen). Select the owner. Press 'browse retail' If item desired is a punchcard, select the desired punchcard option. If item is a retail item, you can either scan the barcode with a barcode scanner, or search for it on the browse retail screen. If retail item is not showing up anywhere, add an 'Other (Read Description) - Taxable' Open line item. Add a description of what the item is and the price. After the customer has left, tell a manager that the item could not be located in Gingr. Check out the customer with their preferred payment method(s) - if needed, see information above for detailed instruction on how to process payment. IF THE QUICK CHECKOUT BUTTON IS NOT WORKING (Daycare): If customer has a punchcard and it is not working, ensure the punchcard type they have matches the daycare reservation type they are checked in for. IF THERE ARE BOTH ADD-ONS AND A DAYCARE PUNCH BEING USED: If there are add-ons (such as a grooming service) to a daycare reservation with a client that has a punchcard, you must add the daycare reservation to the cart and follow the steps below:

title: Booking Grooming Appointments
content: Booking Grooming Appointments Booking Grooming Appointments Operating Procedure Note: This procedure is for standalone grooming appointments only. Grooming services that are attached to a pre-existing reservation must be added on to the actual reservation itself. Navigate to the ' New Appointment ' screen (Navigate to the left-hand-side menu, 'Reservations' > 'New Appointment'.) Add pet(s)'s name under the 'Select Pets' section. Verify last name is correct. Under 'Service Category', select the only option available, 'Grooming' Under 'Appointment Type', select desired service. Under 'Specialist', select: For baths or nailtrims: always select 'Paws Bather'. For full service groom, select the appropriate full service groomer. The date field will autopopulate with the next available opening. Select the desired date (if a date is "grayed out" it is unavailable. ​​​​​​​For nail trims, after the date is selected, select only the drop off time and skip to step 8.​​​​ Under 'Appointment Time', select the desired time. Green next to a time means it is available , and red means the time is unavailable. ​​​​​​​ ​​​​​​​ Note: if a client desires a time and it is not available (red), select the next closest time option and write the actual time in the notes. Let the client know the computer shows we only have a certain time available, but it is actually ok to come in at their desired time. The client will get a text and email confirmation with the date and time selected, so we want to make sure the customer is aware of this. ​​​​​​​If desired, add any service options under the 'Appointment options' section. Write any notes under the 'Notes' section. Press 'Create Appointment' once all details are finalized. Note: Customer will promptly get email and text confirmation of the appointment with the date and time. Please ensure the date and time is correct before pressing 'Create Appointment'.

title: Understanding Store Credit and Deposits
content: Understanding Store Credit and Deposits Understanding Store Credit and Deposits Overview Store Credit A Store Credit is a type of discount. You can think of it as a balance they can use on their account, like a gift card. Once a Store Credit has been added to a Client's account, it can be applied to an Invoice at check-out, either on the same day it was added or on the future date. Store Credits CANNOT be exchanged for money. They have no "cash value ". Deposits: A Deposit is a pre-payment by a Client. FULL PAYMENT MUST BE COLLECTED when the Deposit is added to the Client's reservation. A $50 deposit MUST be taken for each boarding reservation, one deposit per family. A Deposit has a monetary value. It can be refunded. Deposits are only required for boarding reservations. A client can put a deposit down for a grooming or daycare reservation if wanted, but it is not necessary. Deposit Policy: I n the event the client needs to change plans, we ask that they notify us two weeks prior to the reservation during peak times or three days prior during non-peak times. With management approval, we can refund the deposit past our deposit policy if the customer experiences something out of their control. Pre-Payments: Pre-payments function just like deposits. You can add Pre-Payments by opening up the invoice for the reservation. Use the "Apply Payment" button to add a Pre-Payment. The uses for Pre-Payments can be: If a customer wants to put down a deposit more than the standard $50 for their reservation. If a customer wants to pay for their service or reservation before check out. (Keep in mind we DO NOT give totals for boarding stays before checkout, and they cannot completely pay for their boarding reservation in advance, since there are a myriad of factors that can change the total price of the reservation before the pet leaves.) When a pet stays for extended lengths of time, we charge their card on file every week and apply a pre-payment to their reservation.

title: Making Notes on Reservation Appointment or Service
content: Making Notes on Reservation Appointment or Service Making Notes on Reservation, Appointment, or Service Operating Procedure When booking a reservation or appointment: For boarding or daycare , add notes to the 'Booking Notes | BUSINESS ONLY' section. For grooming , add notes to both the 'Booking Notes | BUSINESS ONLY' section', AND the 'Service Notes' section. Note: the 'Service Notes' section is visible to customers through the online portal. Adding notes to ADDITIONAL SERVICE when booking a reservation or appointment: To add a note to an additional service , select the desired additional service and write the note here: Note: if a pet is not supposed to get a gourmet treat, it must be written here. Adding notes to an existing reservation or appointment: Navigate to the desired reservation or appointment. Click the pencil icon at the top right of the screen. Select 'Edit Booking Details' For boarding or daycare, add notes to the 'Booking Notes | BUSINESS ONLY' section. For grooming, add notes to both the 'Booking Notes | BUSINESS ONLY' section', AND the 'Service Notes' section. Press 'Save' at bottom of screen to save. Adding notes to an existing additional service: Navigate to the desired reservation or appointment. Open the 'Services' tab. Select the menu button (three lines, looks like a hamburger), next to the desired additional service. Select 'Edit Service'. Write any notes under the 'Service Notes' section. Press 'Save Changes!' at the bottom of the screen to save. ​​​​​​​ ​​​​​​​

title: Booking a First Day of Daycare
content: Booking a First Day of Daycare Booking a First Day of Daycare Operating Procedure Start by navigating to the 'New Reservation' screen. There are two ways to achieve this: On the left hand side menu on Gingr, go to Reservations > New Reservation. Or, on pet or owner profile screen, press the calendar with plus button at the top right of the screen, and press 'New Reservation.' Ensure pet(s)' name is selected under the 'Pet's' section. Ensure last name is correct and the correct pet(s) are selected. Select desired booking type under the 'Type' section . Select date. Add the ' First Day! ' service under the ' Additional Services ' section. If necessary, write any reservation notes under the 'Notes' section. Press 'Save' at bottom of page to save. It will display a notice saying, "A lodging must be selected for each date of this reservation." Proceed to press 'Override & Create,' as we do not reserve rooms for daycare reservations in advance. If you need to access the daycare reservation for any reason after you press save, you can do so by clicking on the confirmation link at the bottom of the screen as soon as you press save, or you can do so by searching for the client's name in Gingr and go to the reservations section to locate the reservation.

title: Staff Scheduling
content: Staff Scheduling Staff Scheduling Operating Procedure This procedure pertains to the senior staff member(s) who are creating the schedule but may be useful to other staff members to know how we create the schedule. The number of staff scheduled is based on how many pets we have in-house. We predict our future occupancy based on current reservations and last year's occupancy. It is best to be slightly over-scheduled and send someone home early or call them out in advance. The Occupied Runs List for the week will be reviewed against the schedule to be sure we are staffing appropriately and must be printed the day before and tasks assigned to double-check that the staffing is adequate. The schedule must be posted at least two weeks in advance. When making the schedule, keep in mind: We want to have a good mix of experienced staff to train new staff. Avoid having two inexperienced staff members on at the same time performing a similar task. Schedule a more experienced bather with a less experienced, more experienced receptionist with a less experienced receptionist, etc. We aim to fully leverage our experienced staff to help accelerate the development of our less experienced team members. Avoid overtime unless it is absolutely necessary. When approving a pick-up or swap, verify that the employee(s) will not incur overtime. Do not count staff members in training. Always schedule trainees with a senior staff member. When we are not busy, we typically schedule 6 in the morning and 4 in the evening. As we get busier, we want to add extra pet care technicians for up to 13 in the morning and 11 in the evening. Add an extra bather on high departure dates. Every Shift Should Include the Following: Manager = Oversees all operations to ensure staffing efficiency and operational accuracy. Receptionist 1 = Primary receptionist; oversees all activity at the front desk to ensure accuracy and excellent customer service. Receptionist 2 = Assists R1 and, when not occupied at the front desk, can help in the back. However, they must remain in a position where they can oversee the front desk in case their support is needed. Reservation Specialist [ No RS on Sunday ] = Handles new customer calls, books reservations, and can assist with front desk duties, cleaning, and other tasks as needed. Shift Lead 1 = Senior shift lead; supervises pet care department and is responsible for coordinating tasks such as training, assigning areas, playtimes, and cleaning. Shift Lead 2 = Assists shift lead 1; supervises pet care department. Pet Care Technicians = Handles cleaning, walks, playtimes, and other pet-related tasks. One must be available to cover group breaks. Every A.M. Shift Should Also Include: Bather = Helps with morning cleaning unless there are a large number of baths. After completing the baths, assists the pet care team as needed. Group Play Attendants = Assists with morning cleaning, creates playlists, conducts new dog evaluations, monitors playgroups, and cleans the play gym and outdoor areas. All positions will start at 6:45 unless otherwise noted. We have found that having two PCT come in at 5:30 to get an early start of cleaning helps with the daycare rush at 7 a.m. If we are not busy we may have the Group Play P.M. Schedule = Every p.m. schedule will usually have one R1, R2, and two Pet Care Technician. During very slow times we may be fine with only one Pet Care Technician. Staff start time should be staggered so they are able to complete all duties with ease. R1 & R2 will be scheduled from 1:30 p.m – 8 p.m. R2 will do the rotations at 2:30, bring the dogs in from play at 3 p.m. and cats. Pet Care Technician 3:30 (hand out feeds), If there is another pet care technician, they can be scheduled for 4:30 to get there in time for walks, etc. R2, and the pet care technicians will do any left-over play times, clean west, etc. R1 (1:30 pm – 8 pm) = responsible for everything that goes on at the front desk R2 (1:30 pm – 8 pm) = helps R1 as needed, otherwise works in back. R2 will do the rotations at 2:30, bring the dogs in from play at 3 p.m. and cats. Pet Care Technicians (1:30-3:30 pm – 8 pm) = hand out feeds, walks, closing tasks etc. During busy times we will have up to 6 staff members in the evening. Ramp up as needed. Manager/Supervisor may send staff home early if we are slow. Things to Keep in Mind When Creating the Schedule Staffing is our biggest expense. We do not want to be overstaffed. We find that with a lean staff everyone is more efficient. Mondays can be busy with departures from the weekends. We may need to schedule an extra person in the morning on Mondays. Fridays are usually very busy with arrivals. We should schedule someone extra in the evening (and sometimes in the morning as well) to complete all of the playtimes for dogs coming in later in the day. Saturdays and Sundays don’t usually need an extra person as we open later and close earlier Keep in mind things going on at the high school such as prom, sports seasons, etc. and plan ahead. Be fair when scheduling: Everyone needs to work holidays. If they request a holiday off, make sure they have or are on for other holidays. High school students should each have the same number of shifts if possible. Try to keep schedules the same from week to week if possible. If you need to put someone on for a day they usually don’t work, ask first. Everyone works weekends. If someone is not available to work weekends on a regular basis, they may be taken off the schedule all together.

title: Pet Handling Basics
content: Pet Handling Basics Pet Handling Basics Operating Procedure This document will outline the basics of good dog and cat handling. Safety comes 1st to ensure pets are happy and healthy when staying with us! Always treat pets with the utmost respect and care. Always keep in mind customer perception, there may be a tour walking through. You should ALWAYS be kind and respectful to all animals in our care. Never raise your voice towards a pet, unless it is absolutely necessary to keep them safe. NEVER put your face near a pet's mouth. If a pet is "experienced staff only" (it will say this on the run card, and in the notes) do not handle them unless granted permission from a supervisor or manager. As outlined in PackPro, keep the leash high up on the dog's neck, keep a short leash, walking the dog to the left of you, and using BOTH HANDS on the leash to maintain control. Do not let dogs interact when on the leash, as some dogs can be unexpectedly reactive on a leash. No handling dogs if you are the only person in the building. Do not take pets through the lobby when bringing them to their suite. Never leave animals from different families unattended. If there is anything unusual about a pet, read their notes, make a new note if necessary, and/or reach out to a supervisor or manager for assistance. Poop should be picked up as soon as you see it, even if it is not from your dog. Discourage indoor elimination. Watch for signs they need to go (sniffing, etc.) let them out before they go inside. See "Managing Group Play Sessions", "Individual / Custom Playtimes", "Completing Eliminations and Walks", and "Performing a Wellness Check" for more relevant information.

title: Paws Terminology

The one closer to the reception desk. New Luxuries: the Luxury Suite hallway that contains LQ 6- LQ 20. It is the one closer to the playgym. Focus playtime: another word for a custom or individual playtime. Focus yards: the smaller, fenced-off play yards in the back of the facility. Arrivals: pets coming in (typically referring to boarding). Departures: pets leaving (typically referring to boarding). Appointment notes: The report we pull up in order to gather luggage for departing guests.

title: Cultivating a Pawsitive Culture
content: Cultivating a Pawsitive Culture Cultivating a 'Paws'itive Culture Our Mission: To enhance the lives of pets and their owners by providing outstanding care. 8 Core Values: Respect to animals and coworkers Integrity Accountability Adaptability and willingness to change Communication Innovation Excellence in care Growth mindset Our objective is to instill a culture where every team member prioritizes the well-being and satisfaction of our pets and customers above all else. Regardless of personal feelings or challenges, we commit to setting aside any distractions at the door and dedicating ourselves wholeheartedly to delivering the best possible experience for both the animals and customers in our care every single day. Paws is what we make it to be. Our continuous goal is to create a stress-free culture where it is enjoyable for both pets and team members, while ensuring we are safe and adhering to our rules, procedures and values.

title: Lodging Calendar Overview
content: Lodging Calendar Overview Lodging Calendar Overview The lodging calendar displays all overnight or daycare guests' location for a given week. If you checked out a pet and forgot what room the pet is in , Navigate to the Lodging Calendar and do a ' CTRL + F ' search for the pet's name. Be sure to keep in mind last name as well! (We have lots of Bellas!) The lodging calendar is an easy way to change a pet's room number. Navigate to the pet (make sure last name is correct!) , and simply drag and drop the pet's name into the new desired room. This will come up with a notice that looks like this: 'Yes, All Dates' should never be selected, as if a pet is currently checked in, it will remove the pet's prior room history. Select 'Yes, From Today' - this is the only option that should ever be selected. 'No, Just the selected date.' should never be selected.
